newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU's Van Miert holds meeting on German telecoms.
newsitem.headline: EU's Van Miert holds meeting on German telecoms.

text.p: European Competition Commissioner Karel Van Miert will meet with his services later on Thursday on the deregulation of the German telecommunications market, he told reporters.

This comes amid repeated allegations that the German government has been dragging its feet regarding the authorisation of two new telecoms operators by November 1 to rival Deutsche Telekom's dominant position.

Van Miert declined to comment on the complaints filed notably by British Telecommunications Plc and Germany's VIAG AG as he was leaving a conference organised by the European Parliament on public services.
But in calling a meeting with his services, even before the deadline for Germany to grant two telecoms licences elapsed, he left little doubt that the Commission was taking the issue seriously.

The Commission made it clear this summer that Deutsche Telekom would not be allowed to introduce new tariff discounts for businesses nor launch a joint venture with France Telecom and Sprint Corp of the United States before new operators were allowed in the German telecoms market.
Bonn said on Tuesday it had awarded three licences, but Telekom's rivals pointed out that only one covered the whole country.
